1.verse: You Walk in the Truth - The elder to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.

2.verse: Beloved, I pray that in all respects you may prosper and be in good health, just as your soul prospers.

3.verse: For I was very glad when brethren came and testified to your truth, that is, how you are walking in truth.

4.verse: I have no greater joy than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.

5.verse: Beloved, you are acting faithfully in whatever you accomplish for the brethren, and especially when they are strangers;

6.verse: and they have testified to your love before the church. You will do well to send them on their way in a manner worthy of God.

7.verse: For they went out for the sake of the Name, accepting nothing from the Gentiles.

8.verse: Therefore we ought to support such men, so that we may be fellow workers with the truth.

9.verse: I wrote something to the church; but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, does not accept what we say.

10.verse: For this reason, if I come, I will call attention to his deeds which he does, unjustly accusing us with wicked words; and not satisfied with this, he himself does not receive the brethren, either, and he forbids those who desire to do so and puts them out of the church.

11.verse: Beloved, do not imitate what is evil, but what is good. The one who does good is of God; the one who does evil has not seen God.

12.verse: Demetrius has received a good testimony from everyone, and from the truth itself; and we add our testimony, and you know that our testimony is true.

13.verse: I had many things to write to you, but I am not willing to write them to you with pen and ink;

14.verse: but I hope to see you shortly, and we will speak face to face.
